label: Jerusalem
description: A city holy to three of the world's major religions, and a central location in the life and ministry of Jesus Christ.

label: Bethlehem
description: The birthplace of Jesus, and the site of the Church of the Nativity, one of the oldest continuously operating churches in the world.

label: Nazareth
description: The childhood home of Jesus, and the site of the Basilica of the Annunciation, which commemorates the announcement of the angel Gabriel to Mary.

label: Capernaum
description: A fishing village on the north shore of the Sea of Galilee that served as a base for Jesus' ministry in the region.

label: Sea of Galilee
description: A freshwater lake in northern Israel that features prominently in the Gospels, serving as a site of several of Jesus' miracles and teachings.

label: Mount of Transfiguration
description: The site of Jesus' transfiguration, where he was seen speaking with Elijah and Moses and where a voice from heaven declared him to be God's son.

label: Garden of Gethsemane
description: The site where Jesus is said to have prayed and agonized the night before his crucifixion, and where he was betrayed by Judas Iscariot.

label: Jordan River
description: The river where John the Baptist baptized Jesus, and an important location in Christian pilgrimage and tradition.

label: Mount of Olives
description: A mountain ridge east of Jerusalem, and the site of several important events in the life of Jesus, including his ascension into heaven.
